commit_list.message: Merge branch 'resource-listing'
Resource / Social Media icons
Removed default rails.png
Updated README with more info and clickable links
Added suitable file-extension to README so GitHub parses it.
(GitHub flavoured) Markdown for README
Updated README with first draft requirements and relevant/useful commands.
Added simple README in place of the Rails default.
first commit
Resource listing (as partial) and basic Homepage HTML structure
Added app/stylesheets, a reset.sass, and a basic application.sass for the Resources list
Added Rails 3 to Requirements in README
Added first Balsamiq mockups to the repos
removed link text

Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:blackradley/buxton

* 'master' of git@github.com:blackradley/buxton:
  Fixed all models to sub em-dash and curly quotes for standard equivalent. Note:Not on server
  Fixed dash and quotes for strategies; fixed activity approver saving
  Fixed comments/notes issue for purpose question; also fixed error if viewing pdf before filling in anything but purpose
  Fixed issue clicking on graph, corrected some wording
  Strip whitespace from strand parameter in section controller
Recipe for git conversion, as far as could be developed previously before the firewall stopped us
Added a .gitignore file
Added newrelic config
Moved exception notification from exceptionnotifier to hoptoad
Future proofed some parenthesizing
Corrected sync task. Changed status param to tab. Eval label regardless.
Use IP addresses not hostnames in SSH script (better cope while DNS changes)

Added new server details and build procedure followed.
Updated SSH scripts with new server locations.
Removed mongrel_cluster configuration and presence in deploy recipe (we're now using Passenger and REE)
Updated deploy recipes to new server configuration and file layout.
Added gem requirements to environment.rb.
Modified sync task to store DB dump in /tmp not ~ for permissions reasons.
Sync task to make matters easier when dealing with remote data
Task to sync server data with local data for testing
Fixed name/email validation to occur at same time for saving directorates. Removed puts.
Up strategy description limit from 255 characters (string to text data type)
Brought question text better inline with input page in act man PDF.
Removed fixed proposed Policy description - now determined by activity status. (In activity PDF)
Corrected negative differential, resources, and lead officer details in PDF report
Don't alter case of reference number
Only cheque the uniqueness of the reference number if it is present (as some activities, from the start, don't have one).
Initialise all ref numbers to an empty string
Disabled e-mail validation for other manager types
Disabled e-mail validation on organisation managers.
Fixed percentage answered handling as per Manjit's request. Added some comments.
Added migration to alter the storage engine for the activities table.
Fixed snag of single quotes in activity names
Reversed block/none change for ticks/crosses as was incompatible with FF3
Improved tooltip refactoring further.
Refactored tooltip generation. Fixed inconsistent display of them.
Handle special characters in PDFs in tables generation.
Added dev note for future
Made comments/notes more robust against special characters. Refactored to use a shared partial.
Fixed snag 70
Removed puts statements
Fixed display of UTF8 characters in the PDF (from the DB) by converting them to ISO-8859-15. Overrode PDF::Writer's text method so this is automatically applied to everything.
Fixed Snag 69 by upgrading PDF library. Character encoding and line drawing to resolve. Improved PDF report link wording. Titlecased activity name to be consistent.
Added install notes for *Magick to repos.
Removed loading of Arial Rounded Black - server doesnt render it properly. Reverted to straight Arial.
svn ignore local organisations directory (it's a symlink on the server)
Fixed snag 68 - last remaining strategic objective references.
Improved display of subdomain box. (On server) Fixed re-generation of images by changing file permissions.
Improved handling of login links to account for any user type in future.
Fixed admin link. Removed case for old staging server in login link generation.
Altered logic of banner header inclusion.
commit --amend
Made organisation header image reference absolute not relative. Refactored to handle future manager types easily.
Commit --amend
Remove ; on link_to_functions causing IE errors as the ; is then duplicated by the helper also inserting one.
Removed organisations directory as we symlink this instead.
Fixed case sensitivity of includes.
Made organisation images shared across deployments.
Moved PSD, TTF files, etc. out of public document root and in to the components directory. Improved requires/includes in banner generation. Fixed 1 pixel offset in banner.

Fixed display of activities in all 3 approval states for all manager types. Set up rcov. Upgraded Rails core files. Added robots.txt to disallow crawlers on the site. Added flash charts plugin. Added a pie chart to the Org Man page. Cleaned up some code.

Nested and named routes for organisations/strategies. Adding two (untested) environments, staging (for pre-production) and demonstration (for laptop demoing). Updated some of the specs accordingly. Cleaned up the views with Rails2 niceties and the named routes.
As an Activity Manager, when on home page - the status (existing/proposed and function/policy) of my activity is displayed

Invalid ID exception-handling and specs.
Updated script/ and public/javascripts/ directories to Rails2 script versions.
Exception handling for RecordNotSaved and RecordInvalid errors. Complete with specs.

Fixed some of the header copyrights/keywords. Fixed some directorate association problems. Added some realistic fixture data and a db:remigrate task to drop all tables, run all migrations, and populate the db with the fixtures data. Great for testing and presenting on a laptop. Note: activity names are only unique within the scope of a directorate now. Also, more fixture data will be needed I'm sure + it must always be kept up-to-date. (Dev note: this loads the fixtures from rSpec not Test::Unit.)

Renamed Function Managers to Activity Managers. IMPORTANT: It is necessary to manually rename the type field in the Users database table accordingly (FunctionManager to ActivityManager). Although we could have an automated script for this, STI behaviour limits the ease of creation and time is better invested in creating the db:remigrate script that will benefit all future changes like this, not just this one alone.
Sections Controller exception-handling specs. Helper for faking the referrer when testing redirects to :back.
Exception-handling specs for Users and Strategies controllers. Cleaned up Activities and Organisation specs.

Updated Users and partially Organisations controller specs.

Lots and lots. Implemented STI so we have the concept, at object level, of FunctionManager, OrganisationManager, and Administrator. Added data conversion to convert all old users accordingly. OrganisationController specs are now both more complete and yet leaner at the same time.
